A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
So its official\, these New Star Wars films are not made for Star Wars fans. Disney has decided to reinvent the universe without many of those traditional hallmark Star Wars signatures; such as well choreographed lightsaber vs lightsaber duels\, usage of a variety of force powers\, the mythos of the orders\, familial bloodlines\, valuable character backstories\, the importance of skill training and that familiar magical sense of viewing a richly established adventure. All of which have solidified the series as the paramount space opera. 
Disney's steering committee has decided to undermine and demystify George Lucas's legacy in what I assume is an attempt to supplant it with a more accessible framework for the broadest of future audiences\, specifically children. 
Needless to say\, I was disappointed as a Star Wars fan in The Last Jedi. Sad as a sci-fi fantasy fanboy but as Mark Hamil himself said "It's not important if its high quality\, only if it makes money. And because Force Awakens made a lot of money\, ergo its good."
Like The Force Awakens before it\, The Last Jedi will surely make billions with a "B" dollars worldwide but will never be considered a good Star Wars installment.
